topic.title: ZeroNet's cryptocurrency of choice?
topic.body: What cryptocurrency do you prefer for ease of use and privacy?

1546138183_12NqXRG5Ur6HzBsgR2kgPxmcWGhR9.body:
> [klu9](#comment_10_131Seivv6aH8vnohPmYPcPwPfZ1a5ubMMs): It's like you've just expanded your internet to include another piece: now with ZeroNet installed, you can also surf ZeroNet sites and download ZeroNet files. You can also make your own ZeroNet site (quickly & easily) without having to worry about finding (and paying) a host, because just by having ZeroNet turned on, we are all helping each other out with hosting and getting sites and files: we don't depend on companies doing it for us (for a price: either our money or our privacy).  [...]

That was a really nice and concise summary, thank you!

1546285113_1LQfRyignLepAZoVq55vajMQTm15w.body:
> [duck0](#comment_3_17bfQv5PQW9FZ4akChr7ECfqP2SKuAXwM5): ╔════════════╗║────────────║║─╦╩╩═╩╩══╗──║║─╣─╔═══╗─║──║║─║─╚═══╝─╚╗─║║─║─╔════╗─║─║║─╣─╚════╝─║─║║─╩╦╦═╦╦═══╝─║║────────────║╚════════════╝Stick with Bitcoin, don't fuck with shitcoins.

Isn't Bitcoin a bit unstable at the moment? (Read: always)
